datafield.subfield: Treating Many-Body Quantum Systems by Means of Classical Mechanics

Many-body physics of identical particles is commonly believed to be a sovereign territory of Quantum Mechanics. The aim of this contribution is to show that it is actually not the case and one gets useful insights into a quantum many-body systemMany-body quantum systems by using the theory of classical dynamical systems. In the contribution we focus on one paradigmatic model of many-body quantum physics - the Bose–Hubbard modelBose-Hubbard model which, in particular, describes interacting ultracold Bose atoms in an optical latticeOptical lattice . We show how one can find/deduce the energy spectrumEnergy spectrum of the Bose–Hubbard modelBose-Hubbard model by using a kind of the semiclassical approach.
